get_wastewater_samples¶

outbreak_data.get_wastewater_samples(**kwargs)¶

Get IDs and metadata of wastewater samples matching a given query.

Parameters

  • country -- String containing name of country to search within.

  • region -- String containing name of region to search within.

  • collection_site_id -- ID of collection site.

  • date_range -- Date range in the format [start_date, end_date], with dates in YYYY-MM-DD.

  • sra_ids -- List of sample IDs.

  • viral_load_at_least -- Minimum viral load threshold for matching samples.

  • population_at_least -- Minimum population threshold for matching samples.

  • demix_success -- Whether to gather only samples with valid lineage mix data.

  • variants_success -- Whether to gather only samples with valid mutation data.

Returns

A pandas dataframe containing the IDs and metadata of matching samples.

Parameter example

{ 'region': 'Ohio', 'date_range': ['2023-06-01', '2023-12-31'], 'server': 'dev.outbreak.info' }

Example Usage

Find wastewater sample data at a specified collection site and minimum viral_load between 2023-09-01 to the last date for wastewater data collection in Ohio:

# Use get_wastewater_latest() to get the last collection date for wastewater data

>>> last_ww_date = latest_ww_date = outbreak_data.get_wastewater_latest(region="Ohio", server='dev.outbreak.info')

>>> outbreak_data.get_wastewater_samples(collection_site_id="USA_OH_5f9e5487", viral_load_at_least=25000, date_range=["2023-09-01", last_ww_date], server='dev.outbreak.info')
